sub_features.name: MLflow Tracing
sub_features.notes: Captures complete inputs, outputs, parameters, and metadata for each intermediate step of a request

sub_features.name: Distributed Tracing
sub_features.notes: Distributed tracing support for tracing complex, multi-step AI workflows natively

sub_features.name: Intermediate Step Tracing
sub_features.notes: Hierarchical tracing of intermediate steps with OpenTelemetry compatibility, but lacking an explicitly visualized complex tree view

sub_features.name: Multimodal Evaluation Tracking
sub_features.notes: Supports evaluating models with multimodal data (text, image) but tracing details are generally limited to basic input/output capture

sub_features.name: One-line Auto Tracing
sub_features.notes: mlflow.<library>.autolog() integrates automatically with 20+ frameworks

sub_features.name: @mlflow.trace
sub_features.notes: Decorates Python functions to capture input/output and block execution traces

sub_features.name: Trace Sessions & Metadata
sub_features.notes: Group and filter traces using session IDs; record user, timestamp, revisions, and metadata

sub_features.name: Token Telemetry
sub_features.notes: Tracks input/output token usage at each logic step, though lacking distinct per-model tokenizer approximation capabilities natively

sub_features.name: OpenTelemetry Compatibility
sub_features.notes: Fully compliant with OTEL standards, supporting context propagation and external tool integration

sub_features.name: Retrieval Metrics Tracking
sub_features.notes: Captures internal components like retrievers in traces, but does not provide a specialized UI explicitly prioritizing document chunk relevance scores

sub_features.name: Component Details Logs
sub_features.notes: Captures and parses tool calls with explicit details mapped beneath the abstractions of agent library frameworks

sub_features.name: Step Trace Storage
sub_features.notes: Stores deep insights into intermediate agent execution steps to pinpoint unexpected behaviors

sub_features.name: Session Trace Grouping
sub_features.notes: Grouping by sessions enables conversational thread review via trace search, though lacking visual multi-turn replay UIs natively

sub_features.name: Multi-Turn Evaluation & Simulation
sub_features.notes: Simulate and score entire conversations for agent testing using session-level conversational scorers.

sub_features.name: Bug Pinpointing
sub_features.notes: Enables users to pinpoint bug sources intuitively, though automated explicit highlighting features aren't present

sub_features.name: Model Context Protocol
sub_features.notes: Model Context Protocol integrated explicitly under MLflow's broader GenAI features structure

sub_features.name: Pre-built Evaluators
sub_features.notes: Provides pre-built LLM judges for applications such as relevance; however, setup is primarily code-based, not via a no-code GUI wizard

sub_features.name: In-UI Trace Evaluation
sub_features.notes: Evaluate traces directly via the user interface using LLM judges, enabling on-demand, no-code trace evaluations.

sub_features.name: Judge Builder UI
sub_features.notes: Enables creation of custom evaluators via a GUI wizard without requiring code

sub_features.name: MLflow GenAI Evaluation Functions
sub_features.notes: Allows authoring of custom heuristic loops, class-based evaluators, and LLM judge rulesets

sub_features.name: MemAlign Judge Optimizer
sub_features.notes: Optimizer algorithm introduced for improving LLM-as-a-Judge evaluation quality and alignment

sub_features.name: Trace-to-Dataset Creation
sub_features.notes: Capture perfect data iteratively from production traffic traces to build high-quality datasets; lacks dedicated full-featured curation UI

sub_features.name: DSPy Framework Integration
sub_features.notes: Compatible natively with DSPy to support prompt optimization features and tracing simultaneously

sub_features.name: Experiment Versioning
sub_features.notes: Tracks changes iteratively allowing devs to trace performance metrics on new versions, but lacks completely automated scheduled regression suite tests

sub_features.name: Production Monitoring Evaluator
sub_features.notes: Real-time non-blocking online evaluation running registered evaluators automatically on incoming trace traffic

sub_features.name: Trace Redaction
sub_features.notes: Configuration capabilities automatically redact PII data originating from application inputs inside traces

sub_features.name: Hallucination LLM-as-a-Judge
sub_features.notes: Built-in real-time monitoring criteria to systematically detect hallucinated generations

sub_features.name: Custom Scorers
sub_features.notes: Developers define real-time evaluation rule sets as code to determine guardrail success but lacks a dedicated guardrail policy engine

sub_features.name: Token Cost Tracking
sub_features.notes: Supports tracking compute token usages as proxies for costs via session tags, but lacks robust built-in per-user/team attribution UI

sub_features.name: Trace Cost Tracking UI
sub_features.notes: Trace cost tracking with explicit UI integration and aggregation, including AI Gateway usage analytics.

sub_features.name: Production Efficiency Observability
sub_features.notes: Monitors aggregate token usage per step identifying bottlenecks and optimizing consumption

sub_features.name: Latency Telemetry
sub_features.notes: Triggers key latency metrics per captured component, though explicit visualization tools representing P99 heatmaps are not provided natively

sub_features.name: Production Error Alerting
sub_features.notes: Tracks failure and anomaly rates systematically across live operational environments

sub_features.name: Custom Evaluator Dashboards
sub_features.notes: Integrates user-defined metrics evaluated on traces into overarching tracking dashboards

sub_features.name: Agent Performance Dashboards
sub_features.notes: Pre-built dashboard views providing core metrics covering latency, request counts, quality scores, and tool call summaries natively

sub_features.name: Experiment Prompt Tracking
sub_features.notes: Prompt versioning recorded inside structured experiment tracking records; lacks dedicated non-developer CMS interfaces

sub_features.name: MLflow End-to-End Tracking
sub_features.notes: Comprehensive classical ML to GenAI experiment monitoring including hyperparameter optimization logging

sub_features.name: Multi-Workspace Support
sub_features.notes: Organize experiments and models across multiple workspaces with coarser-level granularity within a single tracking server

sub_features.name: Lifecycle Integration
sub_features.notes: Export data flows natively into comprehensive pipeline management tools configured externally for fine-tuning

sub_features.name: End-to-End Version Lifecycle
sub_features.notes: Provides native rollbacks alongside ML flow versioning linked natively to the Model Registry

sub_features.name: Supported SDKs
sub_features.notes: Includes comprehensive python implementations (mlflow, mlflow-tracing) and JS/TS integration; Go is not supported

sub_features.name: AI Gateway
sub_features.notes: Provides a proxy-based gateway facilitating centralized LLM API management alongside base MLflow functionality

sub_features.name: Library Agnostic Integration
sub_features.notes: Built-in integration covering 20+ architectures like LangChain, OpenAI, LlamaIndex, Pydantic AI, DSPy, and Vercel AI

sub_features.name: REST API
sub_features.notes: Offers REST-based searching and metric evaluation API endpoints; explicit Webhook logic not integrated by default

sub_features.name: Enterprise Lifecycle Management
sub_features.notes: Handles quality gate tracking automatically allowing developers to integrate CLI workflows natively within traditional CI servers

sub_features.name: Self-Hosting Deployment
sub_features.notes: Infrastructure hosted locally to avoid supplementary SaaS obligations entirely

sub_features.name: Linux Foundation Project
sub_features.notes: 100% free offering possessing over 20K GitHub repository stars without vendor dependency restrictions

sub_features.name: Local Storage Rights
sub_features.notes: Organizations retain complete unmitigated data sovereignty utilizing local hosting; explicit SOC 2 SaaS compliances don't apply similarly to OSS

sub_features.name: Analytics Integration
sub_features.notes: Offers seamless integration to automate metrics reporting natively onto traditional cloud stores like BigQuery, S3, or Snowflake
